snippet: The authorities had pursued charges against the foreign citizens even though they planned no attacks against the United States.
abstract: Somali-born men Ali Yasin Ahmed, Mohamed Yusuf and Madhi Hashi plead guilty to charges of conspiracy to support terrorist group, based on their having fought for Shabab in Somalia, lowering their potential prison terms to maximum of 15 years; case is one of several in which federal terrorism charges have been brought against foreign citizens who planned no attacks on United States.
lead_paragraph: The authorities had pursued charges against the foreign citizens even though they planned no attacks against the United States.

headline.main: 3 Somali Natives Who ‘Went Home to Fight’ Plead Guilty to Terror Charges in Brooklyn
headline.print_headline: Somali Fighters Plead Guilty in Brooklyn
